intro: Leucas aspera var. wightiana, commonly known as Wight's leucas, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, clustered in whorls along the stem, and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
